docs.lead_paragraph: The issue of child day-care has been on liberal agendas since the 1820's when New England reformers established dozens of "infant schools" to serve the children of working brothers. But not until recently, when the Federal Government threatened sharp reductions in support of social services,

headline.main: Woe for the Working Mother; Day Care Cuts

docs.abstract: R J Margolis article revs arguments for and against federally subsidized day-care for children of working mothers
